Alternate translation: "So they counted all the men of Israel ... in each of their families" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: So all the men of Israel ... were counted in each of their families

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Moses and Aaron did not count the men who were descended from Levi" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the men who were descended from Levi were not counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: In some languages this is a passive verb. If needed, this can be written differently. Alternate translation: "who were from the tribe of Levi" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who were descended from Levi

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When it is time to set up the tabernacle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When the tabernacle is to be set up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Any stranger ... must die" or "You must kill any stranger who comes near the tabernacle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Any stranger ... must be killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Moses and Aaron counted them all" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All those counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form Alternate translation: "the priests whom Moses anointed and ordained" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the priests who were anointed and who were ordained

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I have given them entirely" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They are wholly given

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must kill any foreigner who comes near" or "any foreigner who comes near must die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: any foreigner who comes near must be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Moses counted all the males from a month old and older" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: All the males from a month old and older were counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Moses counted 8,600 males" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: 8,600 males have been counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the holy things which the priests use for service" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the holy things that are used in their service

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Moses counted 6,200 males" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: 6,200 males have been counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must kill any foreigner who approaches the sanctuary" or "Any foreigner who approaches the sanctuary must die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Any foreigner who approaches the sanctuary must be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "Yahweh's word" refers to Yahweh who spoke to Moses. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that Yahweh had told him to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: he was told to do by Yahweh's word

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that I have specially selected for myself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: reserved for me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This phrase refers to the death of the Kohathites. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "to do anything that will cause me to completely remove them from among the Levites" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: to be removed from among the Levites

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Whatever work that these things require" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Whatever should be done with these things

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Moses and Aaron counted the descendants of Gershon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The descendants of Gershon were counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom Moses and Aaron counted by their clans" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: counted by their clans

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Moses and Aaron counted the descendants of Merari" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The descendants of Merari were counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom Moses and Aaron counted by their clans" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: counted by their clans

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "by his type of work assignment" or "by the type of work he had assigned each man to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: by the type of work he was assigned to do

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if the person whom the guilty person has wronged" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if the wronged person

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the things that the people of Israel set aside and bring to the priest" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the things that are set aside and brought to the priest by the people of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: These phrases can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "his wife has defiled herself ... his wife has not defiled herself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his wife is defiled ... his wife is not defiled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that he will show to your people as a curse" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that will be shown to your people to be such

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the curses he has written" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the written curses

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "if she has defined herself by committing" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if she is defiled because she has committed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Her people will curse her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The woman will be cursed among her people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "has not defiled herself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is not defiled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "defiles herself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is defiled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "vinegar that people make from wine" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: vinegar made from wine

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he separates himself to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he is separate to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "nothing that people make from grapes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: nothing that is made from grapes

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one is to use a razor on his head" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: no razor is to be used on his head

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "to Yahweh are complete" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to Yahweh are fulfilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "He must set himself apart to Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He must be set apart to Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he has separated himself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he is separated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he has reserved himself for Yahweh" or "set apart for Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: reserved for Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "He must not count the days before he defiled himself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The days before he defiled himself must not be counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he defiled himself" or "he made himself unacceptable" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his consecration was defiled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone must bring him" or "He must go" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He must be brought

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "bread he made without yeast" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: bread made without yeast

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "fine flour that he mixed with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: fine flour mixed with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "wafers without yeast which he rubbed with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: wafers without yeast rubbed with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that he had boiled the ram's shoulder. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the shoulder of the ram that he boiled" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the boiled shoulder of the ram

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the priest waved" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that was waved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that he presented" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that was presented

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the promise that the law for the Nazirite indicates" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the promise indicated by the law for the Nazirite

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "fine flour that he had mixed with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: fine flour mixed with oil

contextId.glQuote: fine flour mingled with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "fine flour that he had mixed with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: fine flour mixed with oil

contextId.glQuote: fine flour mingled with oil

contextId.glQuote: fine flour mixed with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "after Moses had anointed it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: after it was anointed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They had made the lampstand" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The lampstand was made

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "of fine flour that they have mingled with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: of fine flour mingled with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Levites set up the tabernacle" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the tabernacle was set up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "moved" or "Yahweh took up the cloud" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the cloud was taken up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the cloud rose up" or "Yahweh took up the cloud" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the cloud was taken up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the command that Yahweh had given through Moses" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh's command given through Moses

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the cloud rose up" or "Yahweh lifted the cloud" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the cloud was lifted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the commands that Yahweh had given through Moses" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh's command given through Moses

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in the active form. Alternate translation: "They named that place" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: That place was named

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "Moses had written their names on the list" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Their names were written on the list

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They named that place Kibroth Hattaavah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-names]])
contextId.glQuote: That place was named Kibroth Hattaavah

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Moses shut Miriam outside the camp" or "Moses sent Miriam outside the camp" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Miriam was shut outside the camp

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Canaanites had built Hebron 7 years before the Egyptians built Zoan" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-numbers]])
contextId.glQuote: Hebron had been built seven years before Zoan in Egypt

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They named that place" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: That place was named

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "who were some of those whom Moses sent" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who were some of those sent

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will remove their protection from them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Their protection will be removed from them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "my glory will fill all the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all the earth will be filled with my glory

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you whom Moses counted in the census" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you who were counted in the census

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "to prevent your enemies from defeating you" or "to give you victory over your enemies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to prevent you from being defeated by your enemies

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that you burn on the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: made by fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must do it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It must be done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must do as I have described" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: must be done as described

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that they burn on the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: made by fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he must burn an offering on the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he must make an offering made by fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the food that the land produces" or "the food that you produce in the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the food produced in the land

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must make a grain offering and drink offering" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: must be made a grain offering and drink offering

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as the decree commands" or "as I commanded when I made the decree" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as commanded by the decree

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will forgive them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They will be forgiven

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that they made by fire" or "that they burned on the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: made by fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will forgive all the community of the people of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all the community of the people of Israel will be forgiven

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will forgive that person when the priest has made atonement" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: That person will be forgiven when atonement has been made

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh had not declared what they should do with him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it had not been declared what should be done with him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must surely put the man to death" or "The man must surely die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The man must surely be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom Yahweh has set apart for himself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who is set apart to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh will set apart that man for himself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that man will be set apart to Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all their sins will destroy you" or "Yahweh will destroy you because of all their sins" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be consumed by all their sins

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "them" refers to the censers. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Let Eleazar make them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let them be made

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the men whom the fire had burned up had used" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that had been used by the men who were burned up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the plague stopped spreading" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the plague was stopped

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom Moses selected from each of the ancestor's tribes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: selected from each of the ancestral tribes

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all sins that anyone commits against the sanctuary" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all sins committed against the sanctuary

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all sins that anyone in the priesthood commits" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all sins committed by anyone in the priesthood

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Any foreigner who approaches must die" or "You must put to death any foreigner who approaches" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Any foreigner who approaches must be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that you do not completely burn on the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: kept from the fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The people must buy them back when they become one month old" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Those that are to be bought back by the people must be bought back after becoming one month old

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that you make by fire" or "that you burn with fire on the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: made by fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the breast and the right thigh that you lift up as a gift to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the raised breast and the right thigh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must consider your contribution" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Your contribution must be considered by you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the people of Israel give to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that have been given to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must keep these ashes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: These ashes must be kept

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one sprinkled the water for impurity on him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the water for impurity was not sprinkled on him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone whom someone else has killed with a sword" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: someone who has been killed with a sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one has sprinkled the water for impurity on him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The water for impurity has not been sprinkled on him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they buried her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People called this place" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: This place was called

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They called that place Hormah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: That place was called Hormah

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "everyone whom a snake bites" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: everyone who is bitten

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Let someone rebuild and establish again the city of Sihon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let the city of Sihon be rebuilt and established again

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "We have devastated Heshbon" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Heshbon is devastated

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all of his people were dead" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: none of his people were left alive

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I know you have the power to bless or to curse people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I know that whomever you bless will be blessed, and whomever you curse will be cursed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "because I have blessed them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: because they have been blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has commanded me to bless the Israelites" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I have been commanded to bless

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. "people must say" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it must be said

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God gave him this prophecy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He received this prophecy

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "other people will give honor to their kingdom" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: their kingdom will be honored

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May God bless those who bless the Israelites; may he curse those who curse the Israelites" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May everyone who blesses him be blessed; may everyone who curses him be cursed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The Israelites will occupy Edom" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Edom will become a possession of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "Seir" refers to the people who lived near Mount Seir. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Israel will also conquer the people of Seir" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: Seir will also become their possession

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the destruction of the Kenites is spoken of as if they were burned up in a fire. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Nevertheless the Assyrians will destroy you Kenites like a fire, and take you away as captives" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Nevertheless you Kenites will be consumed by fire when Assyria carries you away captive

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom Phinehas killed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who was killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom Phinehas killed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who was killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they counted them in each of their clans" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: counted in each of their clans

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must divide the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The land must be divided

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom the leaders of Israel counted" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who were counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must divide the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the land must be divided

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will divide it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be divided

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "and you must distribute the land to them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: distributed to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that the leaders also counted clan by clan" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: counted clan by clan

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom the leaders counted" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who were counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but the leaders did not count them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they were not counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Here "inheritance" refers to land inherited. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. Alternate translation: "because Yahweh said they would not receive any land as an inheritance" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: because no inheritance was given to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom Moses and Eleazar the priest counted" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who were counted by Moses and Eleazar the priest

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom Moses and Aaron the priest had counted" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who had been counted by Moses and Aaron the priest

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when they counted the descendants of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when the descendants of Israel were counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "be a law that all the people of Israel must obey" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be a law established by decree for the people of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the food offerings that you will burn on the altar produce" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the food of my offerings made by fire to produce

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. "the burnt offering" or "the offering you have burned by fire on the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the offering made by fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. "which you have mixed with" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: mixed with

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that Yahweh commanded at Mount Sinai" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that was commanded at Mount Sinai

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that you burned on the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: made by fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "like the one you offered" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: like the one offered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: mixed with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: mixed with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that you burned on the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: made by fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must offer one male goat to Yahweh as a sin offering" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: One male goat as a sin offering to Yahweh must be offered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. "you must have a feast" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a feast is to be held

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. "you must eat bread without yeast" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: bread without yeast must be eaten

contextId.occurrenceNote: The idea of "burnt" can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must burn an offering on the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you must offer a sacrifice made by fire, a burnt offering

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: mixed with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which Yahweh requires each morning" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: required each morning

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "As I, Yahweh, have described here" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: As described here

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must burn the food offering on the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the food of the offering made by fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must offer it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It must be offered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: mixed with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "fine flour which you mix with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: fine flour mixed with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: mixed with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will obey Yahweh's decree" or "you will obey what Yahweh had decreed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will obey what has been decreed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "an offering you burnt on the altar to Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: an offering made by fire to Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "fine flour which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: fine flour mixed with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. "you must burn it on the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a sacrifice made by fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "fine flour which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: fine flour mixed with oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as were commanded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as were commanded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as were commanded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as were commanded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as were commanded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as were commanded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you must burn it on the altar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: an offering made by fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as were commanded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "a woman whom a man has divorced" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a divorced woman

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "every tribe sent 1,000 men to war" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: one thousand was provided from each tribe

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "everything that someone has made of animal hide, goats' hair, or wood" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: everything made of animal hide and goats' hair, and everything made of wood

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Count all of the possessions that the soldiers took" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Count all the plundered things that were taken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Collect a tax from the soldiers' plunder and give it to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then levy a tax to be given to me from the soldiers who went out to battle

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which he will present to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be presented to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The soldiers' part of the sheep" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The half that was kept for the soldiers

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "to be an offering to Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be an offering presented to Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "give this land to us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let this land be given to us

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he destroyed all the generation ... sight" or "all the generation ... sight had died" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all the generation ... sight was destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "land" refers to the people who live there. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if Yahweh subdues before you the people living in the land" or "if they help you subdue the people living in the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if the land is subdued before you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "people later changed the names of these cities" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: their names were later changed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as commanded by Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "where the people could not find water to drink" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: where no water was found for the people to drink

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that no one will kill the accused man before the community is able to judge him in court" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so that the accused man will not be killed without first standing trial before the community

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must certainly execute him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: He must certainly be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the relative must certainly execute the accused man" or "the accused man must die" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: the accused who struck him must surely be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the one you anointed with holy oil" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the one who was anointed with the holy oil

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone must execute the murderer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the murderer must be killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "according to the testimony of witnesses" or "as witnesses testify to the murder" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as testified to by the words of witnesses

contextId.occurrenceNote: The testimony of one witness is not enough to execute a person for murder. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "But the word of only one witness is not enough for you to execute a person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: But one witness' word alone may not cause any person to be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You must execute him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-idiom]])
contextId.glQuote: He must certainly be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to when a person intentionally kills another person. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When someone has shed blood in the land, only the execution of the murderer can make atonement for the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: No atonement can be made for the land when blood has been shed on it, except by the blood of the one who shed it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh commanded you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You were commanded by Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "will no longer belong to our ancestor's share" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be removed from our ancestor's share

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "It will belong to" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It will be added

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it will no longer be a part of our inheritance" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be removed from the assigned share of our inheritance

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "their share will belong" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: their share will be joined

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will take our tribe's share of the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: their share will be taken away from the share of our ancestors' tribe

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Let them marry whom they want" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let them be married to whom they think best

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but they may only marry someone from their father's tribe" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they must marry only within the family of their father's tribe
